intro: Calcearia amabilis, commonly known as the pretty face flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Calcearia amabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
